body.name: LG 34WP60C-B 34-Inch 21:9 Curved UltraWide QHD (3440x1440) VA Display with sRGB 99% Color Gamut and HDR 10, AMD FreeSync Premium and 3-Side Virtually Borderless Screen Curved QHD Tilt,Black
body.merchantInfo: Sold by North To South (WE REPORT RETURN FRAUD) and Fulfilled by Amazon.
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 13. Order within 15 hrs 6 mins.
features: Computer monitor with QHD Display features a wide 21:9 aspect ratio to view multiple documents at once, as well as immerse you in your favorite movies and games
High-quality image production, color, and brightness with HDR10 and sRGB 99% color gamut
High 160-Hertz refresh rate with 1-millisecond Motion Blur Reduction (MBR) is ideal for fast-paced games
AMD FreeSync Premium improves baseline FreeSync technology, with fluid and tear-free gameplay and video with compatible video cards
OnScreen Control software allows you to control various display settings with a single mouse click
body.description: Whatever the task, the LG UltraWide Monitor unveils a panoramic view and high-performance features to push productivity to new levels. 34-Inch Curved UltraWide QHD HDR Monitor with 160Hz Refresh Rate features a wider view for working,watching, or play. Curved QHD (3440x1440) VA Display with 21:9 ratio features realistic, accurate color, contrast, clarity, and detail at wide angles. The sRGB 99% Color Gamut coverage with HDR 10 brings work and virtual worlds to life, backed by 400 nits of brightness. This display tech elevates textures, elements, character movements and natural light and shadow. 3-Side Virtually Borderless Display has a tilt and height adjustable stand.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Visual Feast with Stunning Curved Design and Precision Color Accuracy
reviews.reviewText: This display is a visual delight that has transformed my computing experience. The 21:9 curved screen and impressive 3440x1440 resolution provide a stunning and immersive viewing environment, perfect for both work and entertainment. The VA display with sRGB 99% color accuracy ensures vibrant and true-to-life colors, making photo editing and content creation a breeze. The ultra-wide format is a game-changer for multitasking, allowing me to have multiple windows open simultaneously without compromising clarity. The build quality is excellent, and the design is sleek and modern. Overall, if you're in the market for a high-quality UltraWide monitor, the LG 34WP60C-B is a fantastic choice that delivers on both performance and aesthetics. Also, if you take care of it, it will take care of you and last a long time. *I am not a gamer.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Very nice monitor for the price, excellent resolution and brightness. Purchased to replace antiquated dual monitor set-up, it is nice having only one screen that is nearly as wide as my two old 25" screens plus no more gap in the center! I was also able to eliminate the dock station since one monitor is now being used, now have only 2 devices using electricity instead of 4.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent monitor, reasonably priced
reviews.reviewText: This is my 3rd 34 Utlrawide from LG. Not had any problems with them at all. Really love doing work, as I am able to have several windows open in one screen. I do not do gaming, so refresh rate (etc) does not matter to how I use it. Great value.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best Bang for Your Buck
reviews.reviewText: I bought the cheaper version because it's the same monitor with a cheap stand; since I was mounting it on a flex arm the stand was not important. This is a very nice monitor for the money. It is a VA rather than IPS, so the colors are more vibrant, and the reduced viewing angle of VA monitors is not really noticeable unless you're going to use it as an off-center secondary monitor.PRO's- Very reasonably priced- A LOT of screen real estate, you can fit about 50 icons on your task bar.- High refresh rate, very smooth scrolling.- At a little over 12 lbs. it's light enough to work well with flex arms and the VESA mount was easy to attach by myself.- I find the joystick settings control easier to use than the usual pushbutton array.CON's- It does cut off the active application indicator bar on the task bar at the bottom of the screen; as you can see, my solution was to simply place the task bar on top. It took some getting used to, but it works.- If you're using it with 1080p monitors the Windows text is a little small. Still readable just smaller than the other monitors. If it's your only monitor you can always change the Windows settings- No G-Sync support, but I don't do a lot of gaming and the Nvidia studio drivers work great.- You might need a bigger mouse pad, it's long way from edge to edge :)BOTTOM LINEIf you've always wanted a widescreen but didn't want to spend over $500 this is the way to go. It's cheaper than the cost of two comparable 1080p monitors, has more screen space and with the curvature is an immersive pleasure to look at.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Work Monitors
reviews.reviewText: I have two of these units and they are superb for general work and play. I am not a gamer so I will leave that for the kids to review. Monitors are perfect size and curved feature is excellent for dual monitor setups. Find em on sale like I did and you will be pleased.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Almost 2 years later, still going strong
reviews.reviewText: I use this monitor for everything. PC gaming, production, even with my M1 MacBook at times. I think this monitor is great quality (remember to turn on HDR) and I've been to MC to compare quality vs price and nothing touches this when it comes to price. I might upgrade one day, but it's already paid for itself in value.ONLY COMPLAINT: The stand it comes with sucks. It's not height adjustable, you can only adjust the tilt. The worst part is that the stand is too deep to fit on most monitor stands. I had to buy a monitor stand with desk mount to be able to have the monitor as close to the wall as possible, and at eyelevel.Other than that, I would recommend to anyone on a budget.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Really good monitor if you switch over to HDR mode in windows.
reviews.reviewText: This monitor replaces an Acer monitor with the same specifications except that the Acer monitor was an IPS panel. When I was looking for a replacement for the Acer monitor that my cat destroyed, I thought I would try a VA panel. When I first connected this monitor, the image was pretty dull. I really wasn’t that happy but it was livable. One day shortly after getting this, I actually read the directions and it talked about going into settings in Windows 10 and turning on HDR mode. When I did that, this monitor came alive. The colors were better than the Acer monitor, and the blacks were darker. I really like this monitor and hope my cat doesn’t destroy it. It doesn’t have speakers, but it does have a headphone jack. One thing I do like about this monitor is the power supply is separate so the power cable running to the monitor is smaller than a standard power cord.

Llevo tres semanas con él, lo uso solo para trabajo y me ha gustado mucho. Este reemplaza a un LG de 29" ultrawide 1080p y la verdad es gran diferencia. Caben muy bien hasta cuatro aplicaciones en forma de cuadrante. Lo recomiendo ampliamente para trabajo de programación y automtización.
Uso la pantalla para trabajar y es muy cómoda para revisar y editar textos, presentaciones y bases de datos. Las películas se ven increibles
